result.execSummary:
The defendant Nancy G Vang was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nancy G Vang

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk Cheree
Case called: 2:56pm
State appears by ADA T.Wetzsteon.  Def appears in person and with Atty Paul Goetz.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW


PLEA:
Ct. 1 (DC)>>NO CONTEST

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
State notes agreement of parties as to the waiver of right to challenge statute of limitations - Atty Goetz agrees and COURT approves.

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty

COURT ORDERS: $50+CC; Defendant may set up payment plan in COC.

Defendant may petition for expungement at the successful completion of sentence.

Adj: 3:02pm
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 28, 2015 at 02:45 pm.

Clerk Cheree
Case called: 3:43pm
State appears by ADA T.Wetzsteon.  Def does not appear and with Atty Paul Goetz.  
(Originally set for plea at 3:30pm)

State notes this matter was set for initial appearance/plea/sentence today - will summons defendant in as this was previous deferred prosecution, which defendant completed successfully.
No warrant is being requested at this time.
Atty Goetz notes defendant is very responsible and is surprised she is not present today; Left message with client but has not spoken with her.

COURT directs parties to set plea for next week - Atty Goetz to advise client of the date and notice to be sent.

Adj: 3:45pm
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 21, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
